alert.note: Alert for Howell (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 04 at 10:07AM CST until March 07 at 5:18PM CST by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...Portions of east central and south central Missouri, including the following counties, in east central Missouri, Phelps. In south central Missouri, Howell, Oregon, Shannon and Texas. * WHEN...Until 400 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1007 AM CST, The Department of Transportation reported flooding from previous heavy rain in the advisory area. - This includes the following low water crossings... Warm Fork Spring River at County Road 323, Carr Creek at Highway HH, Spring Valley at Highway N, Mahans Creek at County Road 501, Rocky Creek at Highway NN, Big Creek at County Road 390 and Piney Creek at County Road 228. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Thayer, Winona, Alton, Birch Tree, Eminence, Summersville, Koshkonong, Montier, Thomasville, West Eminence, Alley Spring, Greer, Teresita, Round Spring, Rover, Wilderness, Couch, Midridge, Akers, Myrtle, Montauk, Ozark National Scenic Riverways, Echo Bluff State Park, Current River State Park, Grand Gulf State Park and Montauk State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
